Title: Goatscaping at Gallup Park
Desc: Goats from Twin Willow Ranch of Milan will be arriving to Gallup Park June 6! The goats will be on a work assignment. Ten goats in all will be busy over the course of three weeks "goatscaping," removing brush from the park's two islands. The footbridges and islands are closed during this project from June 6-27. Goatscaping is an old-fashioned, eco-friendly and entertaining form of brush control.

Title: YpsiArboroo #8
Desc: Join Intellect Records for their 8th edition of YpsiArboroo! This event takes place over three days at multiple venues across Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti. Please visit the website for more information on venues and music schedule.

Title: Kill Move Paradise by James Ijames
Desc: Where do the souls of black boys taken too soon go? Set in an otherworldly place, the play follows four black men ripped prematurely from Earth by racist acts of violence, as they confront the brutal reality of their pasts and scramble to make sense of their surreal new world. Audacious, often funny, and original, Kill Move Paradise challenges the way we think about those slain at the hands of police brutality and vigilante justice. Directed by Diane Hill.

Title: Shakespeare in the Arb 2019: Twelfth Night
Desc: It's time for Shakespeare in the Arb! This season's play is Twelfth Night, directed by Kate Mendeloff of the U-M Residential College, Carol Gray, and Graham Atkin and performed by U-M students and community players.

Title: Ya'ssoo Greek Festival
Desc: Ya'ssoo Greek Festival invites you to enjoy authentic food, participate in the raffle for amazing prizes, and experience all that Greek history and culture has to offer.

Title: 14th Annual Arab Film Festival
Desc: The Arab American National Museum's 14th annual Arab Film Festival invites film lovers and cultural adventurers to experience the latest features, documentaries and shorts from the Arab World and the U.S.. This year centers on the theme of home and community, and what it means to different people.

Title: She Kills Monsters
Desc: Dungeons & Dragons, and pop culture, oh my! Join the quest and journey to the mysterious land of Athens, Ohio, circa 1995. Grieving the loss of her younger sister Tilly, Agnes Evans embarks on an adventure to discover Tilly’s truest self in the role-playing game Dungeons & Dragons. This action-packed dramatic comedy leads Agnes and audiences through a funny, fantastical world of love, loss, friendship, fairies and the occasional homicidal cheerleader.

Title: Critters Up Close
Desc: Every month, visitors get up close and personal with some favorite critters from the natural world, thanks to friends at Leslie Science & Nature Center! Join the Hands-On Museum for a meet and greet with critters from 10-4 on Saturday (with a mid-day “Animal Naptime”) and 1-4 on Sunday. This month the featured critters are lizards, and they are ready for their close up! Fun for the whole family.

Title: Tom Russell
Desc: Tom Russell came originally from Los Angeles and lived for many years in El Paso. He's written vivid historical songs, ambitious portraits of love gone wrong, big Nashville hits, slices of barroom gloom, anthems of social commentary, profound religious statements ("Blue Wing"), a career-making song about an epic cockfight … you name it! Tom Russell songs have been recorded by Johnny Cash, Doug Sahm, Nanci Griffith, and a hundred others. Best of all, he comes to Michigan with a new release, "October in the Railroad Earth," which he describes as "Jack Kerouac meets Johnny Cash in Bakersfield."

Title: 8 Pointless Minutes - A Long Form Improv Jam
Desc: Come to Pointless to play in a long form jam! Sign up for a spot when you get there, and each group gets ... you guessed it ... eight Pointless minutes. All experience levels welcome. Come to watch or to play.

Title: Adaptive SkateFest
Desc: This FREE event is designed for veterans, active duty service members, people with disabilities and their families, this adaptive SkateFest offers free stand-up ice skating lessons taught by certified Learn to Skate USA instructors. Each one-hour session includes a skating lesson, practice time and a group photo. Complimentary skate rental and adaptive equipment (skating sleds and walkers) available if needed, and all ages and skill-levels are welcome to attend.

Title: Beer and Board Games
Desc: Get out of the rain/sunshine/snow/tornado/weird-Michigan-weather and play board games while enjoying brewed-on-site craft beer! Bring your own games or use theirs. Bring some friends or meet some new ones.

Title: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week
Desc: Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price: $15 for lunch and $28 for dinner, with many restaurants offering 2 for 1 pricing. Make reservations early! Please visit the website for more information.

Title: Grillin' 2019 - A Benefit for Food Gatherers
Desc: Don't miss out on the best picnic of the year! Grillin', a benefit for Food Gatherers, returns for its 30th anniversary! Featuring live music, amazing food from dozens of local restaurants, cas bar featuring MI microbrews and wines, a raffle and silent auction, kids activities and complimentary massages and much more!

Title: Mean Girls Trivia - Sporcle Live
Desc: Calling all burn-outs, wannabes, JV jocks, and mathletes for Mean Girls trivia! All losers go in the burn book, all winners go to Shane Oman's Halloween party.

Title: Miss Kim Favorites - Suckling Pig Party
Desc: Along with perfectly roasted tender Suckling Pigs with crisp cracklings, think Miso Butter Squash, Popcorn Korean Fried Chicken, Soy Butter Rice, and so much more. You won't want to miss this delicious dinner event!

Title: The Ryan Montbleau Band
Desc: In 2005, Ryan Montbleau and his band headed into Applehead Recording in Saugerties, New York, to cut their debut album. With nothing more than ambition and a relentless work ethic to their names, they bootstrapped the whole thing, maxing out credit cards to fund it themselves and launch their careers from the ground up. Twelve years, eleven records, thousands of shows, and 60 million Spotify streams later, Montbleau returned to the studio for a special one-night-only concert that would become the latest entry in his venerable catalog: ‘Woodstock Sessions.’

Title: Washtenaw 2030 Town Hall
Desc: If you’re a Washtenaw County local with thoughts on how the area could improve the visitor experience in the community, attend this town hall meeting and provide your input. This event is a forum for community members who have ideas for how to create a strategic vision and roadmap toward improving the visitor experience in the Ann Arbor area, as well as generating economic benefits for those who live and work here.

Title: Front Country
Desc: An acoustic band born in the land of tech innovation, Front Country was never going to be accepted as an authentic American roots band out of the gate. Cutting their teeth in progressive bluegrass jams in San Francisco’s Mission District and rehearsing in the East Bay, they learned to play roots music their own way, with the tools they had on hand. A mandolinist with a degree in composition and classical guitar. A guitarist trained in rock and world music. A bassist equally versed in jazz and bluegrass. A violinist with a technique that could seamlessly hop between honky tonk and electropop. A female lead singer with grit and soul that was also a multi-instrumentalist and songwriter. Now they've moved to Nashville, released a new album, "Other Love Songs," and continued to impress listeners of all stripes as one of the most exciting roots bands around.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Summer Picnic
Desc: An easy menu to take with you on a perfect picnic day.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Jessica Merchant
Desc: Chef Nikolas will show you how to "fustinify" these recipes from the national author, blogger and Fustini's fan. "How sweet it is!"

Title: Kaia Kater
Desc: A Montreal-born Grenadian Canadian, Kaia Kater grew up between two worlds: her family’s deep ties to folk music and the years she spent soaking up Appalachian music in West Virginia. Her old-time banjo-picking skills, deft arrangements, and songwriting abilities have landed her in the spotlight in North America and the UK. Kaia started her career early, crafting her first EP, "Old Soul" (2013), when she was just out of high school. Since then, she’s gone on to release two more albums, "Sorrow Bound" (2015) and "Nine Pin" (2016). For her third album, "Grenades," she has taken a decidedly different direction, choosing to lean into a wider array of sounds and styles, in order to convey a wider array of emotions and topics, most notably her paternal ancestry. Grand Rapids singer-songwriter Olivia Mainville opens.

Title: Shadow League Show
Desc: Head on down to Pointless for their Thursday night special, the Shadow League Show! This weekly show includes some of the best up-and-coming improv talent in the area, featuring the Pointless incubator team, Finance Camp.

Title: Kill Move Paradise by James Ijames
Desc: Where do the souls of black boys taken too soon go? Set in an otherworldly place, the play follows four black men ripped prematurely from Earth by racist acts of violence, as they confront the brutal reality of their pasts and scramble to make sense of their surreal new world. Audacious, often funny, and original, Kill Move Paradise challenges the way we think about those slain at the hands of police brutality and vigilante justice. Directed by Diane Hill.

Title: Gallery Reception - David Hile Drawings: Naure, Emotion, Symbol
Desc: David Hile's work is inspired by the late 19th and early 20th century Masters Picasso, Modigliani, Castorati and Schiele, as well as Japanese woodblock prints. In the future, Hile plans to expand into other mediums, but for now is happy to continue to explore his artwork through his drawings. Please visit the website on more information about this artist.

Title: Shakespeare in the Arb 2019: Twelfth Night
Desc: It's time for Shakespeare in the Arb! This season's play is Twelfth Night, directed by Kate Mendeloff of the U-M Residential College, Carol Gray, and Graham Atkin and performed by U-M students and community players.

Title: Goatscaping at Gallup Park
Desc: Goats from Twin Willow Ranch of Milan will be arriving to Gallup Park June 6! The goats will be on a work assignment. Ten goats in all will be busy over the course of three weeks "goatscaping," removing brush from the park's two islands. The footbridges and islands are closed during this project from June 6-27. Goatscaping is an old-fashioned, eco-friendly and entertaining form of brush control.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Vegan Fustinified
Desc: Learn how to incorporate the flavors of Fustini's into delicious vegan recipes.

Title: Brad Phillips
Desc: Brad Phillips is a homegrown musician from Michigan and is no stranger to the stage at The Ark. Brad has spent his entire life and career in the Mitten, where he grew up in Saline, playing bluegrass, newgrass, old-time, Celtic, jazz, pop, and singer-songwriter music. Brad’s unique ability to span a wide range of genres on violin, mandolin, and guitar, as well as refined composing and arranging skills makes him one of Michigan’s most sought-after acoustic musicians and a prime example of a 21st-century independent musician.

Title: Pointless Improv with This Is a Quiz
Desc: A fun evening of improv featuring the 2018 Shadow League, This Is a Quiz, now in prime time! The evening kicks off with an opening set from a guest improv group. Next, This Is a Quiz, the group you came to love on Thursday nights, takes the stage with their hilarious stylings. The show wraps up with the League of Pointless Improvisers performing Water Form, the style of long-form improv developed in-house specifically for The League.

Title: Ann Arbor Summer Festival 2019
Desc: A boutique music and arts festival, the nearly four-week gathering offers 150+ performances, activities, exhibitions, and screenings representative of the best in music, dance, comedy, film, circus and street arts, and family entertainment. The festival produces two concurrent programs, one indoor and one outdoor, at various venues and spaces across the University of Michigan campus and in downtown Ann Arbor.

Title: Drink & Draw / Imbibe & Inscribe
Desc: Unwind from the workweek and flex your creative muscles while enjoying exclusive Pointless craft beers. They will provide the writing and drawing prompts, doodle starters, colored pencils and markers, you provide your awesome self and your desire to relax and have fun.

Title: Live Music: James Henes
Desc: James Henes is an emotive singer/songwriter armed with vast influences from hard rock to folk. An open-book policy on lyrics combined with riff-driven chord structure help create the soundscape to the songs of his life...always approaching a song with a conviction and sincerity...

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: The Roux Brothers
Desc: Winners of multiple Michelin Stars, Albert and Michel have created delicious dishes with a French flair.  Chef Nikolas will show you how to "fustinify" these award winning recipes.

Title: Dave Tuck Skate Jam VI
Desc: Head out to the Ann Arbor Skatepark for this benefit to support Grind For Life's work in helping people with cancer treatment expenses. Skate contests for all ages, music all day, raffles, giveaways, fun stuff of all kinds. Celebrating the life of Ann Arbor's own Skate Legend, Dave Tuck.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Mediterranean Table
Desc: Recipes inspired by the northern shores of the Mediterranean.

Title: Pointless Improv Shows
Desc: These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including their resident company, The League of Pointless Improvisers.

Title: 10th Annual Ann Arbor Comic Arts Festival
Desc: The annual Ann Arbor Comic Arts Festival is a collaborative production of Kids Read Comics and the Ann Arbor District Library—promoting and celebrating a lifelong love of comics with workshops, art activities, and one-on-one encounters between comics readers and comics makers. Please visit the website for more information.

Title: Father’s Daze: Bill Harley, Don White, Bil Lepp
Desc: Father’s Daze is a delightful view of the world through the eyes of three Dads who just happen to be highly accomplished humorists, storytellers, & performers.

Title: Eversight : Gift of Sight Golf Classic
Desc: Eversight and the Ann Arbor Host Lions Club invite you to join them for the Gift of Sight Golf Classic to raise awareness and funds in support of Eversight charitable programs and vision research.

Title: 5th Annual Ypsi Prom
Desc: Friends with Benefits is celebrating their Fifth year of Prom and they couldn't be more excited! They will host Karaoke - $1 to sing until 10:00 p.m.. There will also be live music and categories for Ypsilanti Royalty including best Ypsilanti Spirit and Life of the Party.

Title: Pop-Up Makerspace: Things that Fly
Desc: Design - Build - Test! Discover your inner engineer in the Pop-Up Makerspace. Today’s Challenge: Things that fly! In honor of June Fly into Summer series, the museum invites you to join in for Fly a Kite day and Father's Day and create fun flying objects with the whole family!

Title: Icebreakers^2
Desc: Combining parlor games with the classic social lubricant (alcohol) to multiply their ice busting powers. They will supply some low-key interactive games and craft beer. Bring your friends or make some new ones!

Title: #GetOutsideDay
Desc: Join the Washtenaw County Parks & Rec Commission for an afternoon of fun at Rolling Hills County Park! Learn about all the great opportunities there are to explore your parks, preserves, and facilities. They'll have sports clinics, an obstacle course, a bounce house, and so much more! Afterwards, you can head over to the Rolling Hills Water Park and enjoy some summer fun at the pool! Kick-off the summer right and learn about all the neat ways you can have new adventures in your parks.

Title: Rasa Dance & Theater Festival
Desc: Don't miss this exciting afternoon of classical and contemporary dance and theater from India, featuring multiple performers from India and across the country.

Title: Jesse Kramer: Antinous as Osiris
Desc: Jazz - Identity, in all its complexities and ironies, is the theme of drummer Jesse Kramer's latest project, Antinous as Osiris, featuring vocalist Sarah D'Angelo, saxophonist Tim Haldeman, guitarist Max Bowen, and bassist Brian Juarez. Please visit the website for more information.

Title: Voices Valiant Adult Choir
Desc: Norma Freeman, conductor

Title: 3rd Annual GrieveWell Kite Festival
Desc: Ann Arbor’s first and only Kite Festival is returning for a third year! The 3rd Annual GrieveWell Kite Festival has been scheduled for Saturday, June 15 from 1-4 PM. Attended by more than 400 community members last year, the festival will once again feature professional kite fliers entertaining the crowd with large kites dancing through the sky to music. Families building and decorating kites. And games and activities for children. With support from our sponsors, GrieveWell is proud to offer a day to celebrate life, honor the memory of friends and family who have passed, and to be a part of the movement to build a community of hope and healing.

Title: CornerFest 2019: 13 Years of Beers
Desc: CornerFest Beer and Music Festival is back to celebrate their Ypsilanti Anniversary! Lucky 13 Years of Beers at Corner Brewery!

Title: Autism Swim Day
Desc: Join Rolling Hills Water Park for this annual Autism Swim Day! This annual early-opening is a great opportunity for individuals with ASD and their families & friends to get acclimated to the water park and enjoy all the slides, rides, and splash areas in a much less-crowded and stimulating environment before the park is open to the general public.

Title: 60s Night! Tunes, Kombucha, Flower Power
Desc: Bust out your bell-bottoms and tie-dye, and join us for a night of rockin' tunes, delicious kombucha, and flower power! The University Flower Bus will be on-site with a pop up flower shop. Peace, love and good vibes!

Title: Mrs. Grossman's Sticker Collage Workshop
Desc: Join Unicorn Feed & Supply for a crafternoon of sticker collage! With a purchase of Mrs Grossman's sticker collage kit, hang in the party room with a resident sticker expert to create a fun work of art out of stickers so beautiful, you'll want to frame! No registration necessary, kids under 12 must have an adult helper present in the store.

Title: Aaron Jonah Lewis
Desc: Aaron is an acclaimed multi-instrumentalist, performer and educator. Aaron has appeared on dozens of recordings from bluegrass and old time to traditional jazz, contemporary experimental, and Turkish classical music projects. He has taught workshops at the Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama in Glasgow and at the English Folk Dance and Song Society in London. He also plays and teaches banjo, mandolin, and guitar and is currently based in Detroit.

Title: The Arcade - Improv Jam at Pointless Brewery & Theatre
Desc: Join in with Pointless to play short-form improv games! All experience levels welcome. Come to watch or to play.

Title: Beer and Board Games
Desc: Get out of the rain/sunshine/snow/tornado/weird-Michigan-weather and play board games while enjoying brewed-on-site craft beer! Bring your own games or use theirs. Bring some friends or meet some new ones.

Title: Sundays in the Garden: Channing & Quinn WSG Heather Quillen
Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Short's Brewing Company, and this event will help raise money for We the People Opportunity Center.

Title: Hands-On Summer of Space
Desc: Join the Hands-On Museum for a Summer of Space! There will be hands-on activities and demonstrations on the floor of the museum every weekday during summer break that match the museum's monthly theme and keep you and your family learning all summer. This month's theme: Fly Into Summer!

Title: 5th Annual Ideas to Action Social Emotional Learning Conference
Desc: This is a full-day experience led by the Eastern Michigan University (EMU) Bright Futures team and its partners. This conference will feature a keynote story slam, professional development workshops, youth panel, and an unconference session.

Title: Lucette
Desc: Born and based in Edmonton, Alberta, Lucette first began exploring her singular narrative voice as a teenager, drawing inspiration from artists as eclectic as Leonard Cohen and Blaze Foley and Amy Winehouse and Etta James. She's toured with Sturgill Simpson, who produced her emotionally dark new album, "Deluxe Hotel Room," and she's appeared at The Ark with Alejandro Escovedo and David Ramirez. This is a young powerhouse songwriter who's gotten the attention of some of the biggest names in roots music, and it's time for Michigan to hear her full show!

Title: Drink & Draw: Monthly Sketch Night
Desc: Join in on this monthly meetup group where fine artists, writers, comic book artists and dabblers are all welcome. Take your supplies and join in!

Title: The James Hunter Six
Desc: Over the span of 30 years, he’s worked on the railway, busked in the streets of London, provided backup vocals and guitar for Van Morrison, played clubs and theaters all over the world, written scores of original songs, and recorded some of the most original and honest British R&B and soul albums of the last two decades. By 2016, MOJO magazine had crowned James the United Kingdom’s Greatest Soul Singer. His gritty, soulful voice has matured well along with his musicianship and songwriting, and he's a rare ticket in the American Midwest—don't miss this chance!

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Michigan Summer
Desc: Ready to make the move to Summer cooking.  Chef Nikolas has a delicious menu to celebrate the season.

Title: Gratzi's Farm to Table Free Cooking Demo
Desc: Gratzi's seasonal Farm to Table series is back! Meet Chef John Somerville at 11:00 a.m. at the Kerrytown Farmer's Market as he procures locally sourced ingredients. Then join him that night at Gratzi Ann Arbor for a free cooking demo with a complimentary micro-antipasti.

Title: Les Poules à Colin
Desc: Taking their name from a traditional song, Les Poules à Colin were raised behind the scenes at folk festivals, learning their craft at kitchen parties amongst some of Quebec’s finest traditional musicians—which included their parents—in a region famous for its living heritage. The group’s sound is a seamless blend of their strong folk upbringing and North American influences that range from old-time to jazz, with some provocative and moody effects.

Title: Stranger Things Trivia
Desc: Get ready for Stranger Things trivia night at the Graduate Ann Arbor! This themed show is totally FREE-to-play and there are prizes to be won! Unless you're trapped in the Upside-Down, you have no excuse to miss this show!

Title: Shadow League Show
Desc: Head on down to Pointless for their Thursday night special, the Shadow League Show! This weekly show includes some of the best up-and-coming improv talent in the area, featuring the Pointless incubator team, Finance Camp.

Title: “Welcome to Paradise,” World Premiere by Julie Marino
Desc: At one age can one find a soulmate? Are there boundaries to true friendship and affection? Two people find each other in the Caribbean and find love and acceptance with each other, despite their differences in age.

Title: A2SF Headliner: BARBU Electro Trad Cabaret
Desc: Headliner of the Ann Arbor Summer Festival!

Title: Crazy for You
Desc: A zany rich-boy-meets-hometown-girl romantic comedy.  Crazy for You tells the story of young New York banker Bobby, who is sent to Nevada, to foreclose on a theatre.  In Deadrock, Bobby falls for spunky Polly, the theatre owner’s daughter.  But Polly takes an instant dislike to the city slicker, so Bobby vows—through razzmatazz, and a hilarious case of mistaken identity—to win Polly’s heart and save the theatre.  Songs include “I Got Rhythm,” “Embraceable You,” “But Not for Me,” “Nice Work if You Can Get It,” and “Someone to Watch Over Me.”

Title: Live Jazz: Rodney Whitaker
Desc: Internationally renowned bassist and Mack Avenue recording artist, Rodney Whitaker is one of the world's best double bass performers and mentors, inspiring and growing the next generation of jazz musicians. Please visit the website for more information and to purchase tickets.

Title: Shakespeare in the Arb 2019: Twelfth Night
Desc: It's time for Shakespeare in the Arb! This season's play is Twelfth Night, directed by Kate Mendeloff of the U-M Residential College, Carol Gray, and Graham Atkin and performed by U-M students and community players.

Title: Michigan Pez Convention
Desc: Are you a fan of Pez? The 4th annual Michigan Pez Convention is coming to Ann Arbor for 2019. The convention brings together fans of the nostalgic candy and its iconic spring-loaded dispensers. The convention is open to the public on Saturday, June 22. There will be more than 30 vendors displaying, selling and trading their Pez goodies.

Title: Open Mic Night w/ Jonas
Desc: Come one, come all and share your gifts with the audience! Sing, strum, dance, tell a joke or juggle, they will cheer and you will shine at the Triple Goddess Tasting Room! Your MC for the evening will be Mr. Jonas Dainius Berzanskis.

Title: Yoga & Kombucha
Desc: Curtis is a local Ypsilanti resident and townie. He currently teaches a slow flow, restorative yoga/mindfulness practice with new wave music. He enjoys teaching and building connections with his community that are everlasting.

Desc: Goats from Twin Willow Ranch of Milan will be arriving to Gallup Park June 6! The goats will be on a work assignment. Ten goats in all will be busy over the course of three weeks "goatscaping," removing brush from the park's two islands. The footbridges and islands are closed during this project from June 6-27. Goatscaping is an old-fashioned, eco-friendly and entertaining form of brush control.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Summer Picnic
Desc: An easy menu to take with you on a perfect picnic day.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Summer Festival Favorites
Desc: Some of Chef Nikolas's favorites to enjoy for your summer entertaining.

Title: The Steven Page Trio
Desc: Steven Page’s distinctive and powerful tenor is among the most instantly recognizable voices in popular music. Newly minted as a member of the Canadian Music Hall of Fame with former bandmates Barenaked Ladies, Steven Page has continued his artistic evolution with a diverse array of solo projects in music, film, theatre and television. He comes to Michigan with a new release, "Discipline: Heal Thyself, Part II." Nebraska-born, Portland-based duo The Talbott Brothers open.

Title: Pointless Improv with This Is a Quiz
Desc: A fun evening of improv featuring the 2018 Shadow League, This Is a Quiz, now in prime time! The evening kicks off with an opening set from a guest improv group. Next, This Is a Quiz, the group you came to love on Thursday nights, takes the stage with their hilarious stylings. The show wraps up with the League of Pointless Improvisers performing Water Form, the style of long-form improv developed in-house specifically for The League.

Title: Drink & Draw / Imbibe & Inscribe
Desc: Unwind from the workweek and flex your creative muscles while enjoying our exclusive Pointless craft beers. The will provide the writing and drawing prompts, doodle starters, colored pencils and markers, you provide your awesome self and your desire to relax and have fun.

Title: Oberun 5k 2019
Desc: Grab some friends, mark your calendar and get ready to celebrate summer! There's no better way to celebrate summer than a 5K dash to a Bell's Beer Garden serving up cold Oberon! Pair this summer favorite with a bottle opener finisher's medal, a finisher's pint glass, a sweet shirt and they'll even throw in corn hole to top the night off!

Title: Summer Solstice - Yoga at the Market
Desc: Join BYAA and The Detroit Street Filling Station in celebrating the first day of Summer and International Yoga day! Bring your family & friends for a fun, team-taught class in the sunshine, creating peace, harmony and community through health, wellness, food & fun! After class head over to the Filling Station for some post yoga fuel with your 10% discount!  *Please bring your own mat and water.

Title: Great Lakes Chamber Music Festival in Residence
Desc: Kimberly Kaloyanides Kennedy, Lawrence Dutton, Paul Watkins, Ivalas Quartet. Presented in partnership with Great Lakes Chamber Music Festival.

Title: Live Music: Nessa
Desc: Nessa brings the best kind of surprise to any music event. Combining whimsy with serious musicianship, Nessa can put audiences into a trance or up on their feet dancing. The music is Celtic-inspired, but presented in a new and unique way. Spicing things up with African, Caribbean, Eastern flavors with classical and jazz influences, Kelly McDermott and her band bring charm and delight to listeners of all ages.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Appetizer Party
Desc: Warmer weather is coming and this class will have you ready to entertain on your patio with a delicious appetizer selection to serve with your favorite wine.

Title: Robyn Hitchcock
Desc: Over the past four decades, Robyn Hitchcock has built a large and distinctive body of work that's established him as one of rock's most respected and beloved iconoclasts. Drawing on roots in the music of John Lennon, Bob Dylan, and the New Wave, his unique songs veer from comic surrealism to slightly melancholy pictures of everyday life. Robyn comes to Michigan for his first new show in five years with several recent releases including a self-titled one he describes as "an ecstatic work of negativity with nary a dreary groove."

Title: Pointless Improv Shows
Desc: These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including their resident company, The League of Pointless Improvisers.

Title: Kite & Rocket Day
Desc: Join Superior Township for Kite & Rocket Day on Saturday, June 22, 2019 from 11:00a -2:00p. The event will be held at Fireman’s Park (corner of Harris & MacArthur Blvd).

Title: Icebreakers ^2
Desc: Combining parlor games with the classic social lubricant (alcohol) to multiply their ice busting powers. They will supply some low-key interactive games and craft beer. Bring your friends or make some new ones!

Title: Movie at Michigan Stadium: Spider-man, Into the Spider-verse
Desc: It's movie night at Michigan Stadium! This free event will allow guests to watch Spider-man: Into the Spider-verse on both video boards starting at 7:00 p.m.! To attend this event, you must register and select a number of tickets you would like (max tickets 8). Please visit the website for more information.

Title: Game Night
Desc: Grab your favorite people and share a laugh over board games & kombucha! Good vibes, for one and all.

Title: Summer Solstice Celebration
Desc: Fly Into Summer with the museum's Summer Solstice celebration! Learn about astronomy, physics and the solar system through fun hands-on activities where you can launch rockets, make your own pocket solar system, and even observe the sun!

Title: George Bedard and the Kingpins
Desc: Start with a Gordon Hall history tour and then on to dinner and dancing! There will be sit-down dinner, dance demonstrations, contests, celebrity judges, amazing prizes and much more. Proceeds will benefit the restoration of Gordon Hall.

Title: Gordon Hall Days
Desc: Something for everyone! Antique and classic car show, porsche car show, vintage market, Colors the Clown, barn raising demonstration, kids crafts, old-timey midway games, 4-H animals display, Afternoon Tea and Fashion Show, Dexter history walk, and more.

Title: Live Jazz: Aguanko
Desc: Conga player and composer Alberto Nacif brings the sizzling Latin Jazz septet, Aguanko, to feature their new, all original Latin Jazz recording "Pattern Recognition." Please visit the website for more information and to purchase tickets.

Title: Light up the Park!
Desc: All are invited to this event as the Friends of the Ann Arbor Skatepark, in partnership with City of Ann Arbor Parks and Recreation and GIVE 365, host a free event celebrating the five-year anniversary of the skatepark's grand opening and to kick off a campaign to help fund much needed lighting for the skatepark.

Title: Maureen Choi Quartet
Desc: The vibrant response from audience and critics alike comes from the natural blend of her refined violin technique with the finesse and power of classical music, flamenco expressions, all kinds of reminiscences from music of the Spanish diaspora and rhythmic Latin-American folklore, coming together to create an expressive voice, previously unheard, that makes audiences spring from their seats at every concert.

Title: Diamonds in the Rust: Annie & Rod Capps, Jan Krist, Jim Bizer and Alan Finkbeiner
Desc: Out of the heart of the Midwest, two veteran Michigan duos join forces in a new quartet/quintet: Diamonds in the Rust. Everyone sings, everyone plays multiple instruments, and the band boasts a trio of respected, award-winning songwriters. The repertoire also includes a few choice selections from the rich musical history of the place where they grew and learned their craft. Perhaps best of all is the palpable joy and camaraderie that happens between good musicians who are also good friends.

Title: 42nd Annual Ypsilanti Historic Home Tour
Desc: Since 1977, the Ypsilanti Heritage Foundation has proudly showcased the community's wealth of historic architecture and heritage. This year's tour features an interesting array of homes, businesses, and community treasures so visitors can appreciate the results of historic preservation and investment in Ypsilanti. A portion of this year's tour proceeds will support the Ladies Literary Club's historic building renovations.

Title: Open Stage at Pointless Brewery & Theatre
Desc: Do you play in a band, do improv, write poetry, belly dance, or have some other talent you would like to perform? Then sign up for an 8 minute spot on the Open Stage, and share your gifts. The Open Stage is a great place to try out your latest project among other artists and supporters. Visit

Title: Beer and Board Games
Desc: Come in out of the rain/sunshine/snow/tornado/weird-Michigan-weather and play board games while enjoying brewed-on-site craft beer! Bring your own games or use theirs. Brings some friends or meet some new ones.

Title: Sundays in the Garden: Planet D Nonet
Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Eastern Market Brewing Co., and this event will help raise money for Ozone House.

Title: Wings & Wheels
Desc: Join Yankee Air Museum on June 23, 2019 for a up-close experience with dozens of stunning classics at our second automobile invitational, interspersed with historic airplanes, and covering two acres of airport ramp at Willow Run Airport!

Title: The Magic of Structured Water for Health and Hado Crystal Water for Healing and Transformation
Desc: Water has the capacity to store information and the infrastructure to deliver messages in the body and human energy field. Water in a molecularly cohesive form – structured water -- becomes Hado (vibrationally enhanced) Crystal Water when exposed to positive words, harmonious sounds, photos of nature, positive intention, etc., as famously demonstrated by Japanese water and Hado researcher Dr. Masaru Emoto in his book, The Hidden Messages in Water. And we now have technology that can measure the human energy field and imprint structured water for consumption with an unlimited number of health-enhancing and consciousness-expanding frequencies – a kind of homeopathy and Bach Flower Essences on steroids!

Title: Tri Goddess Triathlon
Desc: Tri Goddess Tri celebrates women of all abilities, inspiring them to reach new heights of health and set new fitness goals by training for and completing a triathlon. Tri Goddess Tri is organized by women who know how to make your first (or hundredth!) triathlon tons of fun! The event is held just 12 miles west of Chelsea at the Portage Lake Unit of Waterloo State Recreation Area, surrounding our participants in scenery as beautiful and inspiring as themselves.

Title: Hands-On Summer of Space
Desc: Join the Hands-On Museum for a Summer of Space! There will be hands-on activities and demonstrations on the floor of the museum every weekday during summer break that match the museum's monthly theme and keep you and your family learning all summer. This month's theme: Fly Into Summer!

Title: Saline Area Chamber of Commerce Golf Outing
Desc: Tee off in style at Travis Pointe Country Club as your 4-some enjoys a full day of golf, great food, contests, & prizes at this annual SACC fundraising favorite.

Title: Jazz - Depot Town Big Band
Desc: A relaxing, family friendly night of big band music and food. Go to Haab's and listen to the Depot Town Big Band play the swingin' tunes of the '30s to today on the 4th Tuesday of each month (minus December).

Title: The National With Special Guest: Courtney Barnett
Desc: Both individually and collectively The National’s members have been involved in countless artistic, charitable and socio-political pursuits.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Mom's Favorites
Desc: Chef Nikolas is adding Fustini's to some tried and true family recipes that have been passed down through the generations.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Michigan Summer
Desc: Ready to make the move to Summer cooking.  Chef Nikolas has a delicious menu to celebrate the season with the produce from Michigan.

Title: Rachel Baiman
Desc: Rachel Baiman has toured for four years with 10 String Symphony and played fiddle for other musicians, including Kacey Musgraves. Now, Baiman has announced "Thanksgiving," a self-produced four-song EP, featuring her live trio as well as special guests including Molly Tuttle and Josh Oliver. "Thanksgiving" is an intriguing follow-up, allowing her a chance to stretch out stylistically, moving effortlessly between bluegrass, to folk, old-time and country. The bittersweet lyricism she’s become known for conveys the push and pull of hardship and hope we often feel during the holiday season.

Title: A2SF Headliner: Dawes
Desc: Headliner of the Ann Arbor Summer Festival!

Title: WCCB Free Summer Concert: A Patriotic Celebration & Pie Social
Desc: Free Concert! The 80-piece Washtenaw Community Concert Band celebrates summer with patriotic music and their annual pie social. Special guests include the Yankee Air Museum Tribute Rosies and guest conductor Jerry Bilik. Also including Zach Gabanyicz, runner-up in the band's 5th Annual Concerto Competition and Dr. Christopher Heidenreich, Conductor and Music Director.

Title: Shadow League Show
Desc: Head on down to Pointless for their Thursday night special, the Shadow League Show! This weekly show includes some of the best up-and-coming improv talent in the area, featuring the Pointless incubator team, Finance Camp. Tickets are $8.

Title: The Adam Ezra Group
Desc: The songwriting of The Adam Ezra Group is making waves around the country. It’s difficult to impart the roots-steeped, road-trippin' essence of the Adam Ezra Group into a single word, but front man Adam Ezra nonetheless keeps one in mind as something of a mantra: COMMUNITY. The Adam Ezra Group plays upwards of 200 shows a year, often devoting their time to local charities and always going out of their way to connect with fans. Adam is creating a powerful, inclusive community around that is beginning to be compared to a social movement as much as a traditional music fan base.

Title: “Welcome to Paradise,” World Premiere by Julie Marino
Desc: At one age can one find a soulmate? Are there boundaries to true friendship and affection? Two people find each other in the Caribbean and find love and acceptance with each other, despite their differences in age.

Title: Crazy for You
Desc: A zany rich-boy-meets-hometown-girl romantic comedy.  Crazy for You tells the story of young New York banker Bobby, who is sent to Nevada, to foreclose on a theatre.  In Deadrock, Bobby falls for spunky Polly, the theatre owner’s daughter.  But Polly takes an instant dislike to the city slicker, so Bobby vows—through razzmatazz, and a hilarious case of mistaken identity—to win Polly’s heart and save the theatre.  Songs include “I Got Rhythm,” “Embraceable You,” “But Not for Me,” “Nice Work if You Can Get It,” and “Someone to Watch Over Me.”

Title: A2SF Headliner: Madeleine Peyroux
Desc: Headliner of the Ann Arbor Summer Festival!

Title: Long Table Discussion: Art / Environment / Sustainability with Mary Mattingly
Desc: UMMA and the Ann Arbor Summer Festival (A2SF) welcome artist Mary Mattingly to Ann Arbor for a three-day residency, June 27–30. Mattingly, whose photograph, Life of Objects, is featured in UMMA’s exhibition The World to Come: Art in the Age of the Anthropocene, is deeply concerned with our relationships to objects—where they come from, where they go, their implications for humans, and their impact on the environment. The centerpiece of the residency is a large-scale public art project titled Objects in the Round, in the Annex tent at Top of the Park on Ingalls Mall where festivalgoers will build a miniature landscape with Mattingly that explores relationships with objects, built landscapes, and habits of consumption.

Title: ASL Story Time
Desc: Join Cultivate for songs, rhymes and stories at 10:00 a.m.! Cultivate will be sharing two stories and some fun signing and rhyming games for 30 minutes. After that you are welcome to hang out and pla.

Title: WCCB - Patriotic Celebration and Pie Social
Desc: Join Washtenaw Community Concert Band's annual pie social with all your favorite patriotic music to put you in the mood for Independence Day.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Summer Picnic
Desc: An easy menu to take with you on a perfect picnic day.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Summer Festival Favorites
Desc: Some of Chef Nikolas's favorites to enjoy for your summer entertaining.

Title: Pointless Improv with This Is a Quiz
Desc: A fun evening of improv featuring the 2018 Shadow League, This Is a Quiz, now in prime time! The evening kicks off with an opening set from a guest improv group. Next, This Is a Quiz, the group you came to love on Thursday nights, takes the stage with their hilarious stylings. The show wraps up with the League of Pointless Improvisers performing Water Form, the style of long-form improv developed in-house specifically for The League.

Title: Dobros Heal the World w/Drew Howard, Mark Lavengood, & Joe Wilson
Desc: It sounds strange, but maybe what the world needs is a little more Dobro! The Ark is going to test the possibility with three world-class Dobro and slide guitar players, for a night to remember! Mark Lavengood (Lindsay Lou), Joe Wilson (Steppin' In It), and Drew Howard (a dozen albums by everyone from Mustard's Retreat to Peter Madcat Ruth) are well known to Michigan audiences for their work with other artists, but they're putting them together for an evening of Dobro synergy. When the Dopyera Brothers, John and Emil, formed the Dobro Manufacturing Company in 1929, they were dreaming of this show—they just didn't know it yet.

Title: Drink & Draw / Imbibe & Inscribe
Desc: Unwind from the workweek and flex your creative muscles while enjoying our exclusive Pointless craft beers. The will provide the writing and drawing prompts, doodle starters, colored pencils and markers, you provide your awesome self and your desire to relax and have fun.

Title: Live Music: Dead Lennies
Desc: The Dead Lennies are an acoustic coffeehouse punk trio based out of Lansing, MI. The band released their six song album titled "George" in October of 2018. They've performed at Triple Goddess Tasting Room in July of last year, so be sure to catch them again on another valiant return!

Title: Live Jazz: Tumbao Bravo
Desc: This exciting Cuban jazz combo has released five critically acclaimed CDs of mostly original compositions that have been featured on all the major jazz public radio stations throughout the U. S.. Please visit the website for more information.  There is no cover charge for this event!

Title: Great Lakes Chamber Music Festival in Residence
Desc: Presented in partnership with Great Lakes Chamber Music Festival.Take a journey through the history of classical music as John Novacek, James Tocco, Lawrence Power and the Callisto and Thalea Quartets perform pieces spanning the 18th to 20th centuries including Robert Schumann’s Piano Quintet in E-flat major, considered one of the composer’s finest works and a seminal piece of 19th-century chamber music.

Title: A2SF Headliner: Evolution of a Sonero - Flaco Navaja
Desc: Evolution of a Sonero delivers a testament to human resilience in a spirited concert tribute. Backed by five world-class musicians, Flaco Navaja draws from Hector Lavoe, The Doors, KRS-1, and many humorous friends and family that shaped him.

Title: Fustini's Cooking Class: Vegan Fustinified
Desc: Learn how to incorporate the flavors of Fustini's into delicious vegan recipes.

Title: Pointless Improv Shows
Desc: These shows are completely improvised, and star an impressive cast of experienced local improvisers, including our resident company, The League of Pointless Improvisers.

Title: Los Lonely Boys
Desc: The abiding sense of family unity and creative rapport that has produced two decades of great music has been built into Los Lonely Boys from the beginning. Indeed, Henry, Jojo, and Ringo Garza have been making music together for their entire lives. Their father, Ringo Garza Sr., was a member of another sibling band, the Falcones, which played throughout southern Texas in the ’70s and ’80s. The family relocated to Nashville in the ’90s, and soon Henry, Jojo, and Ringo Jr. began writing and performing their own material as a trio. They recorded their eponymous debut album in 2003 at Willie Nelson’s Pedernales studio in Austin, and Epic Records picked up Los Lonely Boys for major-label distribution in early 2004. The album quickly won the band a large national audience.

Title: Icebreakers ^2
Desc: Combining parlor games with the classic social lubricant (alcohol) to multiply their ice-busting powers. Pointless will supply some low-key interactive games and craft beer. Bring your friends or make some new ones.

Title: Imagination Take Flight
Desc: This weekend, stop by the Hands-On Museum and let your imagination take flight! You will have the chance to imagine life as a pilot, an astronaut, or an engineer as you participate in hands-on activities and design challenges. Choose your adventure!

Title: German Park Biergarten Picnic
Desc: Held three times a year, German Park picnics attract thousands of visitors every year after 75 years of serving traditional German-American hospitality to the public. Please visit the website for more information.

Title: Community Support Event for Food Gatherers
Desc: Join Triple Goddess Tasting Room as they help raise money for Food Gatherers on June 29! Portions of proceeds from purchased drinks will go to Food Gatherers, so go in and have a good time for a good cause!

Title: The Arcade - Improv Jam

Title: The Go Rounds
Desc: The Go Rounds are bits of all your favorite bands exploded into rock n' roll confetti. Their unique brand of Psychedelic Americana Pop crosses, blends, and deconstructs genres from indie to country to art-rock and baroque folk, creating an accessible and engaging experience that will leave you telling your friends. The songs are catchy, twangy, and trippy, led by Graham Parsons' spellbinding vocals, which weave through lush sonic textures and the band’s master class of intricate arrangements.

Title: Beer and Board Games
Desc: Come in out of the rain/sunshine/snow/tornado/weird-Michigan-weather and play board games while enjoying brewed-on-site craft beer! Bring your own games or use theirs. Brings some friends or meet some new ones.

Title: In Conversation: Life and Afterlife of objects w/ Mary Mattingly and Curators Jennifer M. Friess and Amanda Krugliak
Desc: Returning to Michigan after a 2016 residency and exhibition at the U-M Institute for Humanities, Mattingly will share how Michigan continues to inform her work. Mattingly’s photograph, Life of Objects, is on view in UMMA’s presentation of the exhibition The World to Come: Art in the Age of the Anthropocene (April 27–July 28, 2019), which explores the impact of human activity on our planet through art.

Desc: In the Festival’s final performance at Kerrytown Concert House, John Novacek, Philip Setzer, Paul Watkins and F-Plus perform works by Snider, Puts and Mendelssohn, as well as a special performance of Setzer’s very own Elegy for Violin and piano.

Desc: 'A Cappella' Around Main is an 'a cappella' celebration every first Tuesday of the summer in downtown Ann Arbor! Enjoy shopping, eating, and being serenaded all at the same time! Singing groups will be strolling the sidewalks and businesses with song.  This month features the Huron Valley Harmonizers, the Arbor Consort, and the Women's Chamber Chorus.

Desc: Camaro Superfest is a weekend activity featuring the nation's largest, longest-running, and friendliest all-Camaro car show. The car show itself takes place at Riverside Park in Ypsilanti on

Desc: First Fridays Ypsilanti is a self-guided monthly art walk hosted throughout downtown Ypsilanti at multiple venues! Each month, the participating venues offer free art activities involving local artists, musicians, and/or tastings.

Desc: Save the date for Ypsilanti Freighthouse's inaugural Booksilanti Readers' Fair! This free, family-friendly event will feature local authors, crafts, book-is artisans, kids story hours and more. Please visit the website for additional details.

Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Odd Side Ales, and this event will help raise money for Friends In Deed.

Desc: A very special performance with friends from Burlington, Vermont, and brother in song, Ryan Werner.

Title: Gratzi's Farm To Table Free Cooking Demo

Title: Nevertheless Film Festival
Desc: Nevertheless Film Festival elevates the work of female-identifying filmmakers, as every film in the program has at least 50% female-identifying filmmakers in leadership positions. The Festival does not define filmmaker as meaning only “director”, but can be producers, editors, screenwriters, cinematographers, and more. Taking place in vibrant Ann Arbor, this festival inspires audiences of all ages, and engages the community in conversation about the power of equal representation behind the camera.

Title: Roustabout Theatre Troupe Presents Big Daddy Shakespeare
Desc: The company will return to the roots of its first Ypsilanti performance with Big Daddy Shakespeare. Harken back to the bard with another Shakespeare compilation, this time built around a new and unusual theme: parenthood. Big Daddy Shakespeare, adapted and directed by Anna Simmons, is a montage of scenes, sonnets, and excerpts that together form a full-length piece exploring all aspects of what it’s like to be a parent from the perspective of William Shakespeare. As he wrote, “If by chance I talk a little wild, forgive me; I had it from my father.”

Title: Gifts of Art Free Concert: The Raisin Pickers
Desc: Part of the Gifts of Art: Bringing the world of art & music to Michigan Medicine series, join in see The Raisin Pickers perform in the Courtyard at noon! The Raisin Pickers are a Manchester-based string band that plays rustic Appalachian, old time swing, bluegrass and Louisiana music. This event is free and open to the public.

Title: Stargazers by Reina Hardy
Desc: Rupert Knox is looking for love in all the wrong planets. He’s an astrophysicist who wants two things in life: to make the astronomical discovery of the millennium and find a date to his sister’s wedding. He may have found both in Claire, a mysterious celestial poet. But when another woman shows up at Rupert’s door, all three star-crossed lovers will have to make big choices about mortality, true love, and whether to stick with vodka or switch to beer. Directed by David Wolber, Stargazers features Kaitlyn Valor Bourque, Eddie Rothermel, and Katelyn Wilson.

Title: Ann Arbor Women Artists Juried Summer Show: Opening Reception
Desc: The Ann Arbor Women Artists will present the AAWA Juried Summer Show at Riverside Arts Center from July 5 - July 26. Ann Arbor Women Artists is an organization of nearly 300 artists, both men, and women from Ann Arbor, Ypsilanti, and the surrounding areas. Works will be selected by the juror, Donn Angel Perez, an architect, artist, and educator.

Title: 24th Annual Rolling Sculpture Car Show
Desc: Taking place on Main, Liberty and Washington streets in the heart of downtown Ann Arbor, the Rolling Sculpture Car Show is a free event, and a one of a kind experience for the car enthusiast. All cars are welcome to exhibit at the Show.

Title: Pedal Pittsfield
Desc: Join Pittsfield Township at Pedal Pittsfield and learn the benefits of being bike-healthy, cycling safety skills, helmet fittings, and more at this FREE event! Registration required by July 10.

Title: Supra Boats Pro Wakeboard Tour 2019
Desc: The Supra Boats Pro Wakeboard Tour is the most dominant, highest credibility professional wakeboard circuit in the world. Comprised of four national cash prize events, the PWT showcases the top athletes from Europe, Australia, Canada, the US and more.

Title: Movies on the Green
Desc: Please join Superior Township for a Movie on the Green! This family event will feature playground games beginning at 8:00 p.m., followed by a current family-friendly movie shown on a 20' screen at 9:30 p.m. Bring your picnic blankets, snacks, and coolers (no alcohol)!

Title: Stomp Out Sarcoma Fun Run and 5K
Desc: This annual family friendly event raises funds for the University of Michigan's Rogel Cancer Center Sarcoma Research Fund. This event is all about bringing community members together with doctors, patients, nurses, physician assistants, patients’ family members, nurse practitioners, and researchers outside the hospital, united in one cause: fighting sarcoma.

In addition to the performances, there is a classic car show, free kids activities, great food, great beer & merchandise vendors. If you have always wished you could have seen Elvis in concert, this is your event.
